Line 52: Line 52:
== Licensing ==
== Licensing ==
â
The TrueCrypt Collective License does not meet the [[Open Source Definition]], and thus has not been approved by the [[Open Source Initiative]]. It is considered "non-free" by all the major GNU/Linux distributions (Debian<ref>[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=364034 Debian Bug report logs - #364034]. Accessed on: January 12, 2009.</ref>, Ubuntu<ref>[https://bugs.edge.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bug/109701 Bug #109701 in Ubuntu]. Accessed on: April 20, 2009</ref>, Fedora<ref>[http://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/distributions/2008-October/000276.html TrueCrypt licensing concern] Accessed on: April 20, 2009</ref>, openSUSE<ref>[http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-buildservice/2008-10/msg00055.html non-OSI compliant packages in the openSUSE Build Service]. Accessed on: April 20, 2009</ref>, Gentoo<ref>[http://bugs.gentoo.org/show_bug.cgi?id=241650 Gentoo bug 241650]. Accessed on: April 20, 2009</ref>). The license is considered "non-free" mainly because of distribution and copyright-liability reasons.<ref>[http://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/distributions/2008-October/000276.html Tom Calloway of Red Hat about TrueCrypt licensing concern] Accessed on July 10, 2009</ref>
+
The TrueCrypt Collective License does not meet the [[Open Source Definition]], and thus has not been approved by the [[Open Source Initiative]]. It is considered "non-free" by all the major [[GNU/Linux distributions]] (Debian<ref>[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=364034 Debian Bug report logs - #364034]. Accessed on: January 12, 2009.</ref>, Ubuntu<ref>[https://bugs.edge.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bug/109701 Bug #109701 in Ubuntu]. Accessed on: April 20, 2009</ref>, Fedora<ref>[http://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/distributions/2008-October/000276.html TrueCrypt licensing concern] Accessed on: April 20, 2009</ref>, openSUSE<ref>[http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-buildservice/2008-10/msg00055.html non-OSI compliant packages in the openSUSE Build Service]. Accessed on: April 20, 2009</ref>, Gentoo<ref>[http://bugs.gentoo.org/show_bug.cgi?id=241650 Gentoo bug 241650]. Accessed on: April 20, 2009</ref>). The license is considered "non-free" mainly because of distribution and copyright-liability reasons.<ref>[http://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/distributions/2008-October/000276.html Tom Calloway of Red Hat about TrueCrypt licensing concern] Accessed on July 10, 2009</ref>
